thread.title: New airport becomes operational today

author: tribuneindia.com
title: New airport becomes operational today
text:
Tribune News Service
Chandigarh, October 18
With the landing of a JetKonnect flight from Delhi at 7.35 am tomorrow, the much-awaited civil air terminal at the new international airport at Jheourheri village in Mohali will become operational. The flight operations from the domestic terminal in Chandigarh have now been shifted to the new terminal in Mohali. An official of the Airports Authority of India (AAI) said the flights were starting as per schedule. Passengers had already been intimated regarding the change in the flight operations. Though there is no official confirmation regarding starting flights to Dubai, sources in the AAI said an announcement was expected by December. To reach the new terminal in Mohali, commuters will have to cover an extra distance. Taking the Tribune roundabout as the take-off point, one of the routes, that is 14-km long, will pass along the cityâ€™s southern Sectors 31, 47 and 48, and Sector 65 (Phase XI), Mohali, before taking a left turn from the traffic junction of the Indian School of Business in Sector 81. The 200-foot-wide road will pass through Aerocity and IT City before hitting the new airport terminal.
